bibl.title: Military Orders regarding Columbia Barracks, June 6, 1900

div1.p: Stark requests that no individual affiliated with Columbia Barracks be permitted to enter a saloon where yellow fever broke out. Endorsements are dated June 6 to June 8, 1900.

div1.head: Military Orders regarding Columbia Barracks, June 6, 1900
div1.opener:
POST HOSPITAL, COLUMBIA BARRACKS, CUBA,
JUNE 6, 1900.
THE ADJUTANT?
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.
SIR:
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend with urgency that no soldier,
teams ter, or civilian employee, connected with this post be permit-
ted to enter for any purpose the saloon at No. 90, Real St. Quemados,
Cuba, under the greatest penalty that can be imposed for the offence.
This building contains rooms for rent and all classes of persons
occupy them. This building is the next to #20, General Lee St.,
where Yellow Fever first developed and its back yard approximates
that of the house from which the Hospital Corps man Teeter was taken
with Yellow Fever.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, A. N. Stark, Capt. & Asst. Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Surgeon.
L. S
1946

div1.head: Military Orders regarding Columbia Barracks, June 6, 1900
div1.p:
Col Bks Havana, Cuba.
RECEIVED, JUN 6-.. Rec'd

HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
& PINAR DEL RIO.

Makes report rel. To certain
places in Quemados, requests that
no soldier, teamsters etc. be per-
mitted to enter them.

Respectfully forwarded
to the Adjutant General, Depart-
ment of Havana and Pinar del Rio.

I have deemed it necessary
to issue an order forbidding all
soldiers, packers and teamsters from
visiting the towns of Quemados and
Marianao unless on authorized bu-
siness or with passes.

T. A. Baldwin
Colonel, 7th Cavalry,
Comdg. Post.

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.
Quemados, Cuba, June 6, 1900.

Respectfully returned to the
Commanding Officer, Columbia Bar-
racks, previous endorsement appro-
ved for the present. A mounted
sentinel will be posted from the
Provost Guard covering the in-
fected houses herein named, and
will allow no persons to enter
these buildings unless authoriz-
ed by the proper medical officers.

By command of
BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

Troop “A” 7th U.S. Cavalry,
Columbia Barracks, Cuba.

Respectfully returned to the
Adjutant, Columbia Barracks, Cuba,
with the information that the
1st End. hereon has been noted,

John D Long.
✓ 2d Lieut, 7th U.S. Cavalry
Provost Marshal.
